content: Mount Milligan continues to be a low cost mine, as you can see, with our quarterly gold production costs at $729 per ounce and all-in sustaining costs on a byproduct basis at $615 per ounce. At the Mount Milligan mine, gross gold sales and copper sales were $68 million and $49 million respectively. During the quarter, the Mount Milligan mine operations average gold price was $1,204 per gold ounce and $2.49 per pound of copper. As noted in the MD&A, the Mount Milligan mine recognized $33 million in positive operating cash flow and $21 million in free cash flow. The only thing in the quarter we are attributable to $28.2 million contributed from the Mount Milligan mine, $1.3 million loss from the ÃksÃ¼t mine primarily exploration costs, and $1.4 million loss from molybdenum business unit. The Molybdenum business unit continues to implement its new streamlined business plan at its Langeloth facility, reducing inventories held and overall working capital to generate cash flow from operations of $7.2 million during the quarter.
